title:
Time-optimal persistent homology representatives for univariate time
  series
abstract:
Persistent homology (PH) is one of the main methods used in Topological Data
Analysis. An active area of research in the field is the study of appropriate
notions of PH representatives, which allow to interpret the meaning of the
information provided by PH, making it an important problem in the application
of PH, and in the study of its interpretability. Computing optimal PH
representatives is a problem that is known to be NP-hard, and one is therefore
interested in developing context-specific optimality notions that are
computable in practice. Here we introduce time-optimal PH representatives for
time-varying data, allowing one to extract representatives that are close in
time in an appropriate sense. We illustrate our methods on quasi-periodic
synthetic time series, as well as time series arising from climate models, and
we show that our methods provide optimal PH representatives that are better
suited for these types of problems than existing optimality notions, such as
length-optimal PH representatives.
